mdRecord.dcterms:title: Carrel 4-20, lower shelf|front edge
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Donohue, Liam Patrick [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Possible reference to non-membership in Greek life ("GΔI" or 'GDI," meaning 'God Damn Independent,' in which 'independent' means no affiliation with a Frat or Sorority. Other Greek organization names, with some modifications, including (scribbled out) "XO HOE," implying the women of Chi Omega are sexually loose (interestingly, the letter chi in Greek represents a velar fricative, so "XO HOE" is almost pronounced like "Ho Ho"). [work]
Student graffiti art and messages inscribed on carrel walls in the new stacks, Alderman Library, University of Virginia, prior to the renovation of the building, 2020-2023. [host]
The text within this image may be offensive to some.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Invective
Sex
Greek letter societies
mdRecord.dcterms:spatial: University of Virginia. Library. New Stacks. Charlottesville, Virginia, United States
